column4: is there a way to do a fresh install of 8.10 from command line?  i think i have a corrupt installation and i tried to dist-update but it tells me there is nothing to update.
fresh install without a cd, i should say.  just internet connection
You can install it a few ways yes, https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation  gives you all sorts of options
oh, maybe a usbstick is the way.  i tried that already but it wouldnt boot.  i'll check that ink.
there were so many options.  i wasnt sure which one to work with.
i'd just like to reinstall.  it seems to difficult.
They all will work.  They just depend on what you have at your disposal, etc.  That page is all about reinstalling.
i didnt see anything on reinstalling
That entire page is about installing.  Which is identical to reinstalling.
is there not a way to force a dist-update?

If its already upgraded, then its up to date.  There's nothing to upgrade.  You mean reinstall those packages?  You'd have to just reinstall all of your packages.  It'd be... not so nice.  But, I guess you could try it.  see --reinstall, and I guess use globbing.
Please watch your language, and your tone.  You're welcome to get support here, but this is not a place for whining.
it seems there more arguing going on than helping :/
ubuntu-desktop is a metapackage, removing it doesn't do a whole lot
I'm no good at very many GUI related issues, sorry.
Try switching to ctrl-alt-f1, logging in, then sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop, then 'startx'
tried that. that screen is all screwy... i see a mouse cursor and hear the harddrive going...
